org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.structure

Class Transaction.Workload<R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.structure.Transaction.Workload<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - The type of the result from the unit of work.
    Enclosing interface:
    Transaction
    Deprecated. 
    As of release 3.2.6, not replaced.

    @Deprecated
public static class Transaction.Workload<R>
extends Object
    A Transaction.Workload represents a unit of work constructed by the Transaction.submit(Function) method on the Transaction interface. The unit of work is a Function typically containing mutations to the Graph. The Transaction.Workload is responsible for executing the unit of work in the context of a retry strategy, such that a failed unit of work is rolled back and executed again until retries are exhausted or the unit of work succeeds with a commit operation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Workload

        public Workload(Graph g,
                Function<Graph,R> work)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a new Transaction.Workload that will be tried to be executed within a transaction.
        Parameters:
        g - The Graph instance on which the work will be performed.
        work - The work to be executed on the Graph instance which will optionally return a value.

    • Method Detail

      • attempt

        public R attempt(BiFunction<Graph,Function<Graph,R>,R> retryStrategy)
        Deprecated. 
        Try to execute a Transaction.Workload with a mapper retry strategy.
        Parameters:
        retryStrategy - The first argument to this function is the Graph instance and the second is the encapsulated work to be performed. The function should ultimately return the result of the encapsulated work function.
        Returns:
        The result of the encapsulated work.

      • oneAndDone

        public R oneAndDone()
        Deprecated. 
        Executes the Transaction.Workload committing if possible and rolling back on failure. On failure, an exception is reported.

      • fireAndForget

        public R fireAndForget()
        Deprecated. 
        Executes the Transaction.Workload committing if possible and rolling back on failure. On failure no exception is reported.

      • retry

        public R retry()
        Deprecated. 
        Executes the Transaction.Workload with the default number of retries and with the default number of milliseconds delay between each try.

      • retry

        public R retry(int tries)
        Deprecated. 
        Executes the Transaction.Workload with a number of retries and with the default number of milliseconds delay between each try.

      • retry

        public R retry(int tries,
               long delay)
        Deprecated. 
        Executes the Transaction.Workload with a number of retries and with a number of milliseconds delay between each try.

      • retry

        public R retry(int tries,
               long delay,
               Set<Class> exceptionsToRetryOn)
        Deprecated. 
        Executes the Transaction.Workload with a number of retries and with a number of milliseconds delay between each try and will only retry on the set of supplied exceptions. Exceptions outside of that set will generate a RuntimeException and immediately fail.

      • exponentialBackoff

        public R exponentialBackoff()
        Deprecated. 
        Executes the Transaction.Workload with the default number of retries and with a exponentially increasing number of milliseconds between each retry using the default retry delay.

      • exponentialBackoff

        public R exponentialBackoff(int tries)
        Deprecated. 
        Executes the Transaction.Workload with a number of retries and with a exponentially increasing number of milliseconds between each retry using the default retry delay.

      • exponentialBackoff

        public R exponentialBackoff(int tries,
                            long initialDelay)
        Deprecated. 
        Executes the Transaction.Workload with a number of retries and with a exponentially increasing number of milliseconds between each retry.

      • exponentialBackoff

        public R exponentialBackoff(int tries,
                            long initialDelay,
                            Set<Class> exceptionsToRetryOn)
        Deprecated. 
        Executes the Transaction.Workload with a number of retries and with a exponentially increasing number of milliseconds between each retry. It will only retry on the set of supplied exceptions. Exceptions outside of that set will generate a RuntimeException and immediately fail.
